noun.description: A mineral of the monoclinic crystal system which consists of an oxide of lead and chromium, Pb₂CrO₅, and occurs as dark red masses.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in James Nicol (1810–1879), geologist. From German Phönikochroit from ancient Greek ϕοινικο-, combining form of ϕοινικ-, ϕοῖνιξ dark red + -χροος -coloured + German -it.
